Author: LarryBird#5327
Content: hmm...a familiar sounding statement

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: VBK seems to only allow detection of reorgs, and cant do anything to prevent it. as a 51% protection it seems not possible without any changes to altcoin code. it is 51% attack detection and i guess the exchanges that never make any changes to their code are supposed to all change their code to detect that a 51% attack already happened. Also, BTC is hard to reorg and data that is written once is just as permanent as data written 512 times, the other 511 are spam

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also being decentralized and allowing anybody to post VBK notarizations is actually bad from what I can tell as it allows the attacker to simply make a lot of notarizations to notarize the attackers chain. There is no indication this is prevented from the whitepaper and if it isnt in the source code it means VBK can be used to help the attackers do a 51% attack. After all if 300 of the 512 hashes are the attackers blockchain, that must be the right one. this is the fallacy of data aggregation. just doing a tally of notarizations gives no assurance at all to the accuracy. It is much better to have a set of known pubkeys that first agree upon the state of the blockchain, then broadcast that as a proposed notarization, which all nodes verify if it matches the local data. This is far from centralized and in fact it is almost as decentralized as sending out a multisig transaction. Even though only MofN people are signing a multisig, it is still decentralized as all nodes are verifying it is a valid transaction. To look at the limited number of signers and conclude it is centralized is not understanding decentralization.

Author: LarryBird#5327
Content: @jl777c keyboard letting off smoke, please standby

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: Anyway, my technical assessment so far is that VBK cannot offer any 51% prevention without changes to the altcoin consensus code. it costs a percentage of coinsupply, instead of a fixed amount. And without any 51% prevention, then what is the entire point of VBK? Let us ignore that exchanges wont be modifying their code to detect reorgs as they can likely already tell that a chain was reorged by looking at debug.log where it says that the chain is being reorged. block by block. Let us ignore that the attacker can very likely use VBK to support his attack if anybody actually used this VBK notarization though, so it is probably good that nobody uses the data. Which all means that all these BTC tx serve no purpose at all, even if it was just 1 per block, let alone 512

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: To make me change my assessment, show me the code that uses the VBK notarizations to stop a 51% attack from happening, without that VBK is just a big giant BTC spam machine

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: Likely it is closed source as there is nothing that uses the VBK notarizations and how can the altcoin chain know about VBK data if there are no changes to the altcoin codebase?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: paycoin and bitconnect as a comparison comes to mind, all unsupportable promises sold to a gullible public giving crypto and in this case blockchain security a bad name, while they blast away blatant misinformation about KMD. I mean comparing dPoW to dPoS??? totally technically inaccurate, but it seems that doesnt matter to VBK

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dPoW is very similar to dPoS since the first three letters are the same, since dPoS is pretty centralized dPoW must be. THAT is the level of technical logic that is being used

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content:
From an article:

`proof of proof  records snapshots of any given blockchain and embeds them (in an aggregated form) in Bitcoin transactions, allowing the former to inherit the latter‚Äôs security characteristics.

These snapshots can be automatically referenced by the protocol in the event of a 51-percent attack to determine the correct chain. The presence of conflicting snapshots for a particular ‚Äúaltchain‚Äù triggers early attack detection (EAD) metrics, which warns users about the potential rewrite before they confirm the transaction and updates them when the transaction is safe to accept.` 

sounds like what jl said, only a warning system

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: It is the most expensive system ever devised to detect that a 51% attack took place, most people just grep debug.log

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, since PoP is fully decentralized, anybody can submit PoP, including the 51% attacker. it seems PoP data can only detect that an attack took place, but not which chain is the attacker chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: until there is some explanation of how VBK prevents a 51% attack, it is not really worth spending much time on as anybody can setup a cron task to monitor debug.log and printout if a 51% attack happened. maybe finding out a bit earlier from the mempool is a bit of extra info, but this seems a million times less value than the cost of BTC spam

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content:
`9.1    Integrating with VeriBlockA blockchain securing with VeriBlock would use a provided library to track VeriBlock and Bitcoin consensus automatically, and then would change their block format and reward structure slightly to accommodate and reward PoPminers, and update the rules of their network consensus to query the VeriBlock library when resolving forks.`

So a little change in the code is necessary to use VBK

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content:
`VeriBlock PoW miners automatically follow several simple aggregation rules to provide summaries of published data (ordering PoP transactions based on a prefix of the published data, which groups all potentially-relevant information for each network together). Additionally, VeriBlock is designed to provide easy subscriptions to early attack notifications on any SI blockchain of interest. This provides an environment where a merchant, exchange, payment processor, etc. has one place (VeriBlock) to acquire security information about all of the blockchains they are interested in, making secure integration with third parties incredibly simple.`

For just a warning system...
